page.title: 12ELVERING
page.content: Gloucestershire has a reputation for{Elver}fishing.These{baby Eels}have crossed the Atlantic from their birthplace in the Sargasso Sea and Ascend the{River Severn}in enormous numbers in early Spring.Most Elvers are caught in simple nets held at the water's edge. During the season it is a common sight to see men leaving Gloucester and heading for the River with their nets.The Elvers that escape the nets work their way up-river and then into tributary streams to isolated ponds where they grow to mature Eels. Many Elvers are now exported to countries like Japan where they are a great delicacy. One of the {Collecting Stations}for Elvers is in this block.
